review_text:
I've stayed here before and the host is very responsive and the place is very well maintained, clean, and felt like home.
My only challenge was that Chicago was experiencing a really cold day (-11degree F) and i arrive around midnight to find the key in the lockbox was frozen in ~1inch of solid ice. Mia was responsive and tried to get me another key from another unit in with a different lockbox, but the key was gone already. After buying a torch lighter from the drugstore (which didn;'t work), and then finding a gas station open all night - was able to get boiling water which melted the ice and let me get the key. Mia was responding to AirBnB notes for about 45min while i was trying these different options (it WAS very cold!). Happy i was able to get in by 1am.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Seems like a complicated check-in process, but the instructions were very clear. It was quite easy to follow the instructions when you were in front of the building. Never had any issues getting in or out. The hosts were communicative with me. Great little location - some fun places to eat within walking distance. Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper - as the other reviews mention, it's an old building - you can hear people moving about very easily. This wasn't a bother for me though. If you are using the couch for sleeping, you may want to bring your own sheets and blanket. I didn't see any in the closets. Finding a spot to park could be an issue if you are coming and going often. After circling the place a few times on the day I arrived (a Friday around 8 pm), I was able to find a spot on the street about a block down from the building. I didn't have to drive again until I left on Sunday, so I'm not sure how parking is at different times of the day. I will definitely try to stay there again if the occasion arises!

review_text: Overall we did not enjoy our stay. We found multiple cockroaches in the washroom and had to leave due it being unsafe and uncomfortable. We left early and the host refused to give a refund for the remainder of our stay and told Airbnb it was our fault that this occurred. The host did not take responsibility or apologize. However, it was a nice location and if the host addresses the issue before letting other guests stay, it could be a good Airbnb.

Stayed about a week
review_text:
I spent a month in Chicago staying at Jaime's. Everything was great for me. Jaime is extremely polite and hospitable. The bedroom is like the pictures. Comfortable bed, good size desk for working, own fridge in the room, plenty of space for unpacking and settling in, and a private bathroom. For those not familiar with the area, the location is great. You're a short walk to the Kimbal station for the Brown line. You can walk a block north or a couple blocks south for lots of dining options. No issues with parking whatsoever. It's about a 25-30 minutes by car by surface streets to the downtown loop. You're a couple minutes from the freeway. Kids and families are out and about in the neighborhood; no safety concerns at all.
I also stayed in Jaime's other listing for a few nights, one of the units downstairs in the same home. Similarly, it was comfortable, clean, and functional. Great stay as well!

Perfect !
The room was so much tidy and clean, nice closet, desk for using your laptop daily. My biggest concern is always cleanliness of the bathroom and it was perfect! You have your own key for the room and for the main door of the house. There is also a nice mini fridge in the room so you can bring your own stuff and keep it cold in there. Kitchen and the living room were very clean too. I loved the living room, it was full of histories from London days that they visited before. They are also Friends fan, favorite !
The location is perfect, Irving Park. Very safe area and neighborhood. There is free street parking outside, you can always find a spot to park your car.
I am so glad that I've found Jaime's place. He and his wife are so kind, friendly and warm couple. Always smiling and asking if everything is okay with the room and the amenities. They are respectful to silence of the house and also helping for recommendations about anything you would ask for in the city.
I'd definitely choose this place again, 10/10 !

Jamie was an extraordinary host! I lived with him for a little over 3 weeks and he made my transition to Chicago seamless.
The place was always clean and had everything you need. He even put some extra touches like toothbrushes, loofahs, etc. He also has two cute, extremely friendly, little dogs that greet you as soon as you walk in, they were great! Jamie also got me two personal size Giordanos pizzas during my stay, they were amazing! The bathroom is not shared so you have full access to that as well as having access to a full kitchen which was super helpful for me since I I to do a lot of meal prepping. The area is really nice around him as well and it was very easy to find parking.
If you are looking for an affordable, comfortable place to stay, Jamie's got the place for you! Thanks again for everything, I wish I could have spent the rest of my stay in Chicago with you!

review_text: The staff at Hotel Felix were super friendly. I was able to drop off my luggage before check-in. There was also complementary coffee and fruit. I knew ahead of time about the additional fee, so that didn't come as a surprise to me like I read in some of the reviews. The room was small, but found it to be a good size for one person. Even though the room was close to the elevators, I didn't find it bothersome. I slept soundly and I'm not a light sleeper. They were also very responsive about an small issue with the AC. A maintenance staff came to make adjustments to the thermostat. I'll definitely consider Hotel Felix again.

review_text:
Hotel Felix is a decent hotel, this not an â€œairbnbâ€ per se as itâ€™s just booking a normal hotel through this app. Room is quite small, but big enough. Felt more up to date than your average hotel around this price point. That being said itâ€™s barebones: no mini fridge, no microwave, no view from the room and no pool. There is a pretty large TV though which was nice, and ice on the level. Location is really good with plenty of restaurants/stores, and easy access to the red line. They provide a couple snacks for breakfast and coffee - better the nothing. Lobby is very nice and staff was helpful enough - ***make sure you donâ€™t change the check in time, the hotel will not respond to your request and your reservation will not go through, you need to keep the check in time 3-5pm.***
This hotel is going to be a place to sleep, and itâ€™s not luxury but if you get a good price I would recommend staying here.

April 2024
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Hotel Felix has great location and perfectly clean. Good internet.
Our only major problem is that they imposed a $22 surcharge upon check-in. When we protested, they immediately brandished a print-out of their Airbnb listing to claim that it had appeared. (Clearly, we were not the first protestors.) When we showed them our Airbnb account and challenged them to find it, they couldn't. Finally, one of the receptionists agreed to waive the fee. But we won't know if that went through til they refund the deposit that they also charged of $75.
Surprise surcharges and big deposits to be refunded at hotel discretion and timetable are part of the reason we switched to Airbnb in the first place. Airbnb needs to require of hotels that they put in writing on the official Airbnb site the hotels' true terms and prices. It is not fair to honest Airbnb hosts to hide terms and costs. Links or fine print are not enough. State it Straight.

Stayed one night
review_text:
Great location! Friendly staff. Lots of nearby parking options, and places to walk.
Parking: used Spot Hero to find discounted overnight parking spot less than 1/2 mile away. Note: you reserve your spot online ahead of time. However, I did pay for on-street parking (a block away) for the first hour to get aquatinted with the area, carry luggage in, check-in, and then I reserved my spot online from my phone in hotel room.
Room: was small like the reviews say; however, I found myself not minding the room size after about 20 minutes. Cute and modern.
Stairs: If you opt to take the stairs instead of the elevator, a staff person must walk up to 2nd floor with you to let you into the stairwell. I guess this is due to a programming issue when the hotel got new keycards - so perhaps this will be fixed in the future. However, access to the stairs to exit is unlocked from your room floor - nice!
Lobby: welcoming, clean, friendly, modern artsy.

They had helpful local recommendations for off-street parking which was very helpful, and the free coffee + fruit in the morning was great. Would stay again for 1-2 nights.

Hotel Felix was a great place to stay for our short trip to Chicago. The room looked just like the photos and was fairly clean. Bed was super comfortable as well. A little bit of an older building/space, but it was perfect for what we needed in our short time there. Only complaint I had was we stayed for 3 nights and no one ever came into the room to clean/swap out our used towels. Not sure if this was something we needed to physically request at the front desk, but we kept putting the sign on the door knob to come in and clean and nothing was ever touched.
Overall, great stay & I'd stay here again in the future.

Rating, 4 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Very nice, clean, minimalistic stay. Hotel Felix is easy to find and in a perfect location in River North. There are many coffee shops, restaurants, grocery stores and corner markets. Public transportation is great. it's very walkable to Chicago's famous museums and parks.
I loved the lobby to hang out with friends and have lunch or a coffee.
This place was perfect for a stay in the city where you want to be out and about but the hotel room is very minimalistic. It has everything you need to be comfortable but don't expect lots of amenities. There is minimal amount of staff--mainly at the hotel lobby--so don't expect room service or making special requests.
Overall very worth the price though given the location, cleanliness and level of comfort. Also I was able to make a last minute booking and it was very flexible.
Working remotely is also not really an option because the WiFi is terrible. Bring an Ethernet cable if you need to video call!

review_text: I was here for two weeks and had a fantastic stay. The location couldnâ€™t be better - one block from a ton of bars and restaurants, 5 minute walk from the L, and 10 minute walk from the lake. The unit is recently renovated, very clean, and well stocked with all that I needed for an extended stay (toiletries, dishes, aluminum foil, etc). Don was easy to communicate with and shared clear instructions for check in and out. Only things to note are that the unit has very little natural light, no central AC (bedroom window unit works great), no in unit laundry (shared laundry is across the hall), and you can hear noise from upstairs - but these things were minor inconveniences far outweighed by everything else it offered. If I am ever back in Chicago, this is the first place Iâ€™ll look to stay again!

review_text: Martys place was the perfect location for all things Chicago. Located minutes away from all hot areas - like Lincoln Park, Michigan Ave., and Wrigleyville. The residential area was situated amongst a beautiful strip of shops, restaurants, and entertainment. The building itself was an older and well loved structure, but the apt. was updated and had all the amenities we needed for our weekend trip. The air conditioner was a bit spotty, but we had a nice cool weekend where we were able to open the windows. The lock situation was also a little sketchy, but the door was reinforced with 2 other locks as well, so it was not a big deal. While there is street parking, it is few and in between. I suggest Spot Hero, we found a spot in a private lot less than 1 block away! Marty communicated everything in advance and with clear directions. They checked in frequently and made me feel like I could come to them about anything. 10/10 would stay again!

review_text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Martyâ€™s place. The location was awesome; close to the bus line plus there were so many great paces to easily walk to from there. The place was also easy to find and instructions for getting in were clear and concise.
If you plan on parking there, be sure to check street signs and know when and where you can park, and for how long. We found a spot right in front of the building and were able to leave our car there for the entire time we were there, but we did get lucky with finding such a close spot. There were other spots available, but several blocks away so just be aware of that.
Our only complaint on the place was that the walls are extremely thin and it felt like we could hear everything going on in the apartments above and around us. Overall though, that isnt enough of a detriment to stop us from wanting to stay there again if we end up back in the area. Thanks Marty!

review_text: Nice, safe, and beautiful neighborhood near restaurants and shops. Efficient, updated, and clean space -- perfect for a couple of people. The bathroom was clean. The cleaning lady was working on the shower floor when we arrived at check-in time so the door was ajar. The key was given to us by the cleaning lady when she finished shortly after we arrived, but I think based on the way she was tinkering with the lock box, we might have had some issues trying to get it out ourselves. Linens were soft, but bed could have been more supportive. Great kitchen with range, oven, microwave, and refrigerator. We didn't cook, per se, due to concerns about all the equipment we would need to make Thanksgiving dinner, but there were enough dishes and bowls for takeout for 3 people. Well heated, maybe overly so, but easy to adjust temperature by opening windows. Our host was quick to respond to problems and was kind with my lack of technical prowess with the TV! We felt safe walking the neighborhood.

review_text:
I don't know if I'm brilliant, or just lucky, to have found this place for my dad and I for our trip to Chicago. We found ourselves lingering in the morning, just enjoying the space, the patio, the coffee, the nearby breakfast/bakeries.
Charming and modern interior, decorated warmly. Comfortable sitting and dining spaces, both indoors and outside. Each bedroom nicely sized, with comfy beds and linens, with TVs! Roomy bathroom, with easily enough room for both of our stuff. Stocked kitchen with any utensil or appliance you might need. Plenty of coffee pods!
This location cannot be beat! A short walk to a bus downtown, or a slightly longer walk to a train downtown. Parking was never a problem, usually directly in front of the unit. The neighborhood is mostly quiet, lovely.
We had to reach out to owners for a question- they addressed it immediately. We felt welcomed and cared for. Excellent attention to detail with all instructions. Would absolutely stay here again!

review_text:
One of my best Airbnb experiences ever. Everything is well-taught. Clear instructions for everything. There is nothing that you cannot find or that you need: details in bathroom and kitchen are mind-blowing. The location is safe and super convenient surrounded by many local bakeries, cafes, and restaurants. (and tbh, Chicago isn't always too safe. so this is very important!) super clean, beautiful, and comfortable for a group of 4. There's a cute patio that offers you a nice little outdoor experience as well.
There are just a few points that can potentially be improved: 1. the heating system is not working equally distributed: the bathroom gets too hot, but the master bedroom stays comparatively cold. 2. The smell from the bathroom stays around the kitchen and hallway for some time after you use it. 3. The door from the bathroom to the bedroom didn't close properly.
All in all, it was nothing but a 5-star experience. We loved our stay there, and we'll definitely go back again. tnx

Our flights came in earlier than the listed check in time, and the Garretts were so kind and accommodating an earlier check in - even saying they thought the trip sounded like so much fun and wishing us safe travels. The inside was so clean, we were able to help ourselves to everything there - including the wine! The instructions and requests were extremely clear and more than reasonable to follow. The beds were SO comfortable and we both slept great. I'm sorry we couldn't stay longer just to have an excuse to use the kitchen! I could go on forever. If you're staying in Chicago, you need to stay here.

It's an easily accessible unit and the instructions for entering are very clear. It's location is in a safe area and well lit. There was plenty of parking available on the street.
The rental is extremely clean and well decorated. Extra linens, pillows and towels were all available. We did have to remove some of the decorations (vases, trays etc) out of the reach of our toddler to avoid being mishandled.
The patio outback is a nice touch. The unit is walking distance to restaurants, cafes and shops. The description and photos are exactly what you get, which was exactly what we hoped for. It's a perfect place for friends and families. And we'd absolutely stay again when visiting Chicago.

review_text: This is a terrific location and all the amenities are high quality. We have all been in Airbnb's with single ply TP and the thinnest of garbage bags the hosts expect you to get to the garbage can without breaking. The Garrets place carries the quality all the way to the small details. It's also beautiful but comfortable and my 4 yr old loved running off energy on the back patio. There was always close parking available and you don't feel like you are putting your life in danger if you need to cross the street to get to it. Plus terrific food options within a couple blocks. It's also super affordable. And they responded fast to a small problem. My husband's family has 2 condos on Millennium Park that we usually can stay in for free (family wedding, so not this trip) and we loved it so much he said the next time we visit Chicago, we will stay here again instead of the free condo downtown!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The good:
Great value for what you get. Affordable, comfortable, great location, great staff. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.
The bad:
Be careful booking a hotel like this through Airbnb. Because we booked through a third party they put a hold on our card for pretty much the total we already paid through Airbnb. If you have room on your card, this isn't a bit issue, but things were tight for us, as we were on a longer trip and this created a great deal of consternation. My biggest issue was that the concierge didn't mention that the hotel would put such a high hold on our card. I hope in future the Millennium Knickerbocker will work better with Airbnb, and be clear about their policies both on the booking and through the check-in process.

review_text:
We stayed at Nicoleâ€™s over the Thanksgiving break. Because we drove into town, it was important to find a place that offered parking. Nicole was very accommodating of our early check-in, which we greatly appreciated.
The unit itself was cute but I couldnâ€™t imagine more than two people staying there, including a couple with a child. Since we came during a cold time, storage was limited, and we found ourselves draping our coats over chairs rather than having a closet.
The unit seemed like she lives in there part-time, which we wish we knew before. The small kitchen was way too cluttered with the stove/counter filled with spices (nice but adds to the clutter) and a fridge filled with condiments. The closet space needed for coats and to put our bags away were locked. We felt like we were invading her space.
The area itself was good. Close to the El and some ok restaurants.
Overall the place is good. I would not stay here again though.

Read the booking carefully. Advertised as $55 but after +$11 in taxes & ~$6 in resort fee +$50 deposit the total was +$70 for the room & $120 w/ the deposit. Itâ€™s been over 2 days & I still havenâ€™t gotten my deposit back.
Check in Staff was a little rude. My bathroom didnâ€™t have a lock which is very unsafe. Anybody can walk in while youâ€™re taking a shower w/ just a flimsy shower curtain separating you. Random people are coming in & out of the room at any time. It wasnâ€™t â€œdirtyâ€ but youâ€™re staying in a lived in room, so expect some mess / clutter. The previous guest left a few items behind.
Great area, lots to do. CVS is next door, Ballys Casino is across the street, jewel is at the corner, shake shack & goddess are down the block.
Decent value for the area if you just need a bed to crash for the night & a hot shower. The bar in the lobby is pretty good. They serve a decent breakfast in the morning (paid) but this wasnâ€™t available during my visit.

Location is just two blocks from Michigan Ave. Ohio street is quiet busy by late morning otherwise great place to stay and enjoy Chicago city life .

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is not a Mom and Pop place. This is a hotel with 17 floors and about 20 rooms per floor. The beds were clean but don't use a black light for the rest of the room.
80% of the staff was helpful or friendly.
I so happen to be there on a very cold day, the heater was not working. I was moved to another room but even though the heater was blowing , there was no way it got over 71.
The place is located a block away from the train and a nice market on the corner.
For what I paid, I give this place 7 out of 10. Would I stay here again??? yes I would because I am more aware and able to adapt.

Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
January 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The location is very good, there are restaurants, shops and points of interest nearby. The place is clean and the staff is friendly, the price is very good. If you don't mind sharing a room with strangers, I highly recommend it. I say this because you never know what kind of people I might have to share a room with.
I still had an issue (it's not entirely the fault of the place but they should prohibit the use of alcohol/cigarette inside to prevent these behaviors): I had to ask for a change of rooms since one of my colleagues was drunk (I don't know if drugged) when returning to the room. He was very crowded to cigarettes, his stuff was thrown around the room, and he started insulting me for no reason, thankfully he didn't physically assault me, but he did give me a lot of fear, more because the room is very small. The staff kindly agreed to change my room and my new colleagues were super friendly thankfully.
